climbs.name: Tumbling Dice
climbs.fa: David Kozak and Linda Pritchett, May 1987

content.description: This climbs the steep face to the right of "Catch A Falling Car".

climbs.name: Nobody Walks Their Car in LA

content.description:
Start off the ramp just below the start of

Catch a Falling Car

. Make a long reach into a small right facing groove (crux) to then gain the crack of

Catch a Falling Star

. Climb the steep face above the crack to the anchor.
content.protection: TR off the communal anchors on the summit of the formation.
content.location:
Climb the face between

Nobody Walks in LA

and

Catch a Falling Car

.

climbs.name: Nobody Walks In LA
climbs.fa: Gary Cobb, Greg Rice & Robert Yucknat, 1982

content.description:
Starts to the right of Catch a Falling Star.

Easily up to a shallow corner, this, then, leads to the horizontal crack on the above-mentioned climb. Cam. The next move, over the bulge, can prove to be quite baffling. No clues given here. Enjoyable face climbing follows past 2 bolts.

Walk off to the left (facing the rock).

Start just right of the descent route for

Catch A Falling Star

, et al atop a boulder. Make a move up onto a thin flake then step right to the right end of the thin flake. Climb up the face above the flake to the top of the dome. You can also climb up the face to the left of this route (and just right of the base of the descent route) at about the same grade.
content.protection: Medium cams and an anchor rope are needed to rig the toprope for this climb.
content.location:
Start just to the right of the descent route for

Catch A Falling Star

, et al.

climbs.name: Catch A Falling Star
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger and Dennis Knuckles, March 1978

content.description: This fun pitch is on the sunny south side of Cap Rock.  Climb an obvious right angling crack until it peters out, then make a 5.8 face move past a bolt to the top.  This route is deservedly popular and odds are you will find a gang of people here.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches, one bolt (3/8"), bolted anchors

climbs.name: Catch A Falling Car
climbs.fa: Andy Brown and Lotus Steele, April 1987

content.description:
Start right of

Nobody Walks In LA

following a slanting crack then straight up past bolts to the top.
content.location:
Located in the center of the face between

Nobody Walks In LA

and

Tumbling Dice

.
